search_information.query_displayed: Why Did You Learn in School Today? Teachers' Perceptions of Causality Wiley, Mary Glenn Eskilson, Arlene Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Why did you learn in school today? Teachers' perceptions of causality
organic_results.snippet: Teachers' attributions of cause for a pupil's past performance are investigated under varying experimental conditions. The conditions varied are the race and sex of the child, and the quality of the past performance. As predicted, teachers' causal attributions for past academic performance differ depending upon the race of the child. Black pupils' performances are seen as more externally caused than are identical performances ascribed to white children. These findings hold regardless of the quality of the past performance. Sex of the stimulus …
